dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 3398 IH: REAL ID Act Modification for Freely Associated States Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Young of Alaska (for himself and Ms. Gabbard) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend the Real ID Act of 2005 to permit Freely Associated States to meet identification requirements under such Act, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the REAL ID Act Modification for Freely Associated States Act.

subsection.text: Section 201(5) of the Real ID Act of 2005 (49 U.S.C. 30301 note; Public Law 109–13) is amended by striking the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands,.
Section 202(c)(2)(B) of the REAL ID Act of 2005 (49 U.S.C. 30301 note; Public Law 109–13) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (viii), by striking or at the end;
in clause (ix), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: is a citizen of the Republic of the Marshall Islands, the Federated States of Micronesia, or the Republic of Palau who has been admitted to the United States as a nonimmigrant pursuant to a Compact of Free Association between the United States and the Republic or Federated States.
